knimeNode.name: Causal Graph Miner (Log)
knimeNode.shortDescription: This node implements the first step of the Hybrid Miner to discover a causal graph from an event log.

fullDescription.intro: This node wraps the ProM's plug-in "Extended Causal Graph Miner" from the package ExtendedHybridMiner. It implements the first step of the Hybrid Miner to discover a causal graph from an event log. A causal graph consists of nodes representing activities and two types of directed edges connecting nodes. Certain edges represent strong causal dependencies and uncertain edges represent weak dependencies. A third type of edges is used to represent long-term dependencies.
fullDescription.option: An activity will be included if it occurs in at least x% of cases; set to 0 to include all activities.
A trace variant will be included if it covers at least x% of cases; set to 0 to include all trace variants.
Lower bound for a strong causality between two activities.
Lower bound for a weak causality between two activities; >set to 100% to avoid uncertain edges.
Lower bound for a strong long-term causality between two activities.
High values mean more emphasis on the split and join behavior of activities; low values mean more emphasis on the detection of concurrency and loops.
